titles.title: Transportation Employee Equitable Treatment Act of 1994
A bill to amend title 46, United States Code, to prevent certain masters and seaman from being taxed on wages by more than one State or political subdivision thereof, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S6522-6523)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 6/7/1994--Introduced. Transportation Employee Equitable Treatment Act of 1994 - Amends Federal maritime law to prohibit an individual who is employed as a master, seaman, or pilot of a vessel in more than one State or local government jurisdiction from being liable for the payment of income taxes in a State or local government jurisdiction other than the one where he or she resides.
